791c21d6-559f-477f-9083-8481d3a9d09a.description: The earner has applied skills to solve real-world problems at three startups/scale-ups and has developed an appreciation of the working environment within early stage and fast growing companies. They can apply lean innovation tools including customer personas, international growth strategies and design thinking to formulate actions and new plans to better establish the startups' product-market fit. Earners can leverage design tools to communicate the value of products to a particular audience.
791c21d6-559f-477f-9083-8481d3a9d09a.name: Virtual Startup Internship: Smart Cities

issuer.summary: issued by Sydney School of Entrepreneurship

badge_template_activities.title: Develop a business expansion plan for the host organisation into the United States taking into account the concerns of various stakeholders and the constraints of available resources.

Develop proposals and collateral to enhance communication of the host organisation's unique value proposition to a particular customer segment. Conduct personal reflections on how the proposed communication method impacts on the host organisation's customer experience
Develop a "Future Press Release" to communicate the benefits and key features of a proposed solution based off the host organisation's existing platform and capabilities.

9dd479d4-5533-4715-8720-4e0bb403de00.description: The earner has applied innovation tools and skills to solve real problems faced by three innovative startups. As a virtual intern, they have an appreciation of the environment in early stage companies and can apply lean innovation tools including customer personas and journey mapping, and competitor analysis to formulate actions and new plans to establish product-market fit. Earners can also leverage social media and pitch decks to better communicate product value to a particular audience.
9dd479d4-5533-4715-8720-4e0bb403de00.name: Virtual Internship Program: Startup Journey

issuer.summary: issued by Sydney School of Entrepreneurship

badge_template_activities.title: Create a customer persona through desktop research and secondary sources. Develop recommendations on usability improvements to the host organisation's product and website.

Students were required to analyse the user journey of the host organisation's product and suggest improvements to the user experience. Students were required to analyse the current performance of a social media campaign and create a plan to improve the performance of the campaign.

Conduct a competitor analysis to assess the market threats to the host organisation and identify alternative market opportunities. Build on the identified alternative market opportunity and create a sales presentation to help gain new business in that market segment.

da9822ef-1274-4e96-ac09-4db08e54590d.description: Earners can apply the tools and techniques of innovation and entrepreneurship from problem identification through to solution and business model ideation. They are able to rapidly identify and transform problems into opportunities for innovation, prototype solutions for the problem, develop appropriate business models to support the creation of the innovation and communicate and present new ideas in an engaging and compelling manner to gain support for the proposed innovation.
da9822ef-1274-4e96-ac09-4db08e54590d.name: Discovery

issuer.summary: issued by Sydney School of Entrepreneurship

badge_template_activities.title: Complete online learning modules with social and individual reflective components.  Optionally participated in collaborative online workshops.
Completed graded assessments, demonstrating competency in the core skills listed.

78e218bc-4b6c-4421-8d08-1837b89cd2e8.description: The earner has developed an understanding of their money mindset, setting financial goals, and considering the impacts of tax, superannuation and credit. They are familiar with the concept of self-employment, the stages of starting their own business and the potential implications of that activity on their journey to financial independence. The earner is also acquainted with the concept of entrepreneurial skillsets, including the entrepreneurial mindset and problem identification.
78e218bc-4b6c-4421-8d08-1837b89cd2e8.name: Invest in Yourself - Exploring Money and Self Employment

issuer.summary: issued by Sydney School of Entrepreneurship

badge_template_activities.title: Completed exercises to identify and reflect on their money mindset; set short-term, medium-term and long-term financial goals, then develop saving plans to achieve those goals; calculate income tax and identify some specific and basic tax deductions; calculate the true cost of credit under different repayment scenarios. In addition completed exercises in basic marketing, including creating a message and identifying a target market, as well as considering an MVP model for their business

2c55f10a-3b84-4e04-9dd5-1783a625720c.description: The earner has developed an understanding of their money mindset, setting financial goals, and considering the impacts of tax, superannuation and credit. They are familiar with the concept of creating a side hustle and the potential implications of that activity on their journey to financial independence. The earner is also acquainted with the concept of entrepreneurial skillsets including problem identification, validation and ideation.
2c55f10a-3b84-4e04-9dd5-1783a625720c.name: Rethinking Your Financial Future

issuer.summary: issued by Sydney School of Entrepreneurship

badge_template_activities.title: Completed exercises to identify and reflect on their money mindset; set short-term, medium-term and long-term financial goals then develop saving plans to achieve those goals; calculate income tax and identify some specific and basic tax deductions; calculate the true cost of credit under different repayment scenarios.

7d5e63ef-9df2-4a64-acfd-2d3dcdfdf4a8.description: The earner has developed an understanding of their money mindset, setting financial goals, and considering the impacts of tax, superannuation and credit. They are familiar with the concept of creating a side hustle and the potential implications of that activity on their journey to financial independence. The earner is also acquainted with the concept of entrepreneurial skillsets including problem identification, validation and ideation.
7d5e63ef-9df2-4a64-acfd-2d3dcdfdf4a8.name: Invest in Yourself - Exploring Money and Self Employment (UOW)

issuer.summary: issued by Sydney School of Entrepreneurship

badge_template_activities.title: Completed exercises to identify and reflect on their money mindset; set short-term, medium-term and long-term financial goals then develop saving plans to achieve those goals; calculate income tax and identify some specific and basic tax deductions; calculate the true cost of credit under different repayment scenarios.

0031c500-a0b2-4e1d-9ef3-746beb589e3b.description: To complete this program, the earner has applied tools and techniques of innovation and entrepreneurship to create an innovative solution to a complex problem. During the workshops earners rapidly discover and validate problems, identify opportunities for innovation, work with a team to prototype solutions using physical and digital methods, develop an appropriate business model, and communicate and present their new idea engagingly and compellingly to gain support for the proposed innovation.
0031c500-a0b2-4e1d-9ef3-746beb589e3b.name: Ignite

issuer.summary: issued by Sydney School of Entrepreneurship

badge_template_activities.title: In small groups, participants completed the following elements as a part of their portfolio of work. Articulated the "problem statement" relating to the complex problem they are creating an innovative solution for, compiled and analysed one form of "validation" to support the effectiveness of their solution and created a paper prototype (sketch) of their innovative solution.

c46d2467-4248-40e1-88df-fe61f756f419.description: Earners have gained practical knowledge on how they can integrate innovative processes such as Human Centered Design, Agile and Lean to influence productivity that will impact on their practical day-to-day operations. They have learned techniques to drive ideation activities and empower staff to use innovative thinking in all aspects of the business; whether it’s in recruitment, system and process development or developing new products or services.
c46d2467-4248-40e1-88df-fe61f756f419.name: Innovate from Within: Reimagining Workplace Productivity

issuer.summary: issued by Sydney School of Entrepreneurship

badge_template_activities.title: Prepared a project implementation plan, that identifies a problem with a developed prototype solution that is ready to be tested.

862ecfa2-9586-4f66-adc4-54d4c7dc2cf2.description: Earners can apply the tools and techniques of innovation and entrepreneurship from problem identification through to solution and business model ideation. They are able to rapidly identify and transform problems into opportunities for innovation, prototype solutions for the problem, develop appropriate business models to support the creation of the innovation and communicate and present new ideas in an engaging and compelling manner to gain support for the proposed innovation.
862ecfa2-9586-4f66-adc4-54d4c7dc2cf2.name: Entrepreneurial Educators Program
